reviewText: Starts out slow, and believe me you'll begin to hope the bereaved father drops dead.I almost CHEERED when he said he was moving out. Then he gets WORSE! Things pick up...////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////When you.. =----- SPOILER ALERT-----=> start to "get" the fact that the "genie" IS, uh,"Supernatural", but he AIN'T no genie, it leaves YOU to figure out -- for yourself -- thathe is either a "friendly ghost" or an angel.Spoiler alert is OVER=------------------------------------------------------------------->////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////I enjoyed this movie, and recommend you buy its companion production ofA Christmas SnowI know that my review wasn't as articulate or "pretty" as the others that rated this a FIVE STARmovie, but it was certainly better than the "Preacher" and the other "dude" that gave this won-derful work-of-love film a single, and a 2-star rating.I say we need more of THESE films,and less:SawSaw IISaw IIISaw IVSaw VSaw VISaw VII The Final Chapter [HD]Saw: The Final ChapterSeesawYou CAN do a lot worse than THIS film.Remember anyone that treats his pet with affection-- eventually --will return to his senses after a crisis.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: I love this movie for these reasons:1- there is a good lesson  that we as human from all ages need to learn: when adversity strike , learn how to move on.2- the plot is simple but good and practical for all ages.3- the children in the movie are so good in acting and the main child is very cute.4- Clean , there are no embarrassing moments. I am planing to watch it again with the children this week-end. I think children can learn from this movie how to move on as well.5- It is eye opener about people's pain and how they could get over the pain and make the best of life.6- And best of all: Heartwarming, and happy ending :)
summary: I learned a lesson from this movie. good family movie.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: This movie appealed to our family with the ultimate message, although the theme resembling a lamp and genie was kind of lame. The acting was good, the characters believable, and their situation heart-rending. It was what they learned along the way that leaves a flavor of inspiration with us, and made it into the kind of movie we'd watch more than once.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: I get rather tired and bored with reviewers that claim to be a Minister, Reverend, Rabbi, and ECT: What difference does it make weather anyone mentions God or Christ, but go off on a tangent that this is not a Christian film............. I say it is, it had all the subtleties and we need more of this type of films.........Good Job Give us more. If this helps with bringing one to God then WHY NOT............

reviewText: This movie starts off rather slow, but then picks up speed as the story line quickens.  Has some fantasy but also makes us think of the things that can happen if we only believe.  Very family friendly, the whole family will enjoy,.

reviewText: My Mother was reading this book and I just had to check out the movie. Cheesy, but a good message. I would watch it again, for the whole family.

reviewText: I enjoyed the movie. It was refreshing, fun, shed a few tears and wonderful ending. I enjoy movies that have a happy ending, no blood and gore. Just a simple happy movie.

reviewText: After a Christmas Snow I wondered how Tracy Trost could top that great film.  While "The Lamp" doesn't quite do that, it is on the same high level.  It is a very moving story and I will be purchasing copies for Christmas presents.
summary: Another win for Trost Motion Pictures
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: I was going to give it a 2 star that would reflect that I didn't like it.  Most of the acting was poor, the story was weak, but the message was positive.  In the end it was a family type movie, you could watch it with your 9+ kid and reflect on the good in your life.
summary: You could watch with your 9+ yr old
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: I ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS MOVIE. VERY THOUGHT PROVOKING AND I HAVE ACTUALLY LOANED THIS TO SOME FRIENDS. DON'T USUALLY LOAN MY MOVIES.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: I bought this movie because of the reviews on here that were so overwhelmingly positive. Some of the other reviews on here mention God and give off the idea that this is a Christian film but they never once mention God, so when they say "Just Believe" you're left to wonder are they referring to believing in God, one's self, or something else entirely.  I guess it's just me but this movie leaves a lot to be desired. I loved the story line behind the movie but it leaves you with a lot of unanswered questions. The story line needs a lot more development. This really could have been a much better film with more character development. You kinda feel like it starts in the middle and abruptly ends. It was a clean movie and we need more of those but there are much better Christian family friendly movies out there for the price.
summary: Just believe in what? No mention of God.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: There were some sad parts but like Hallmark movies the ending was great. The start is a little slow and I didn't like the main actor guy as much but the movie gets better.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: This movie has gotten me in trouble lol its sooo good  I told my friends about it and one called me and cursed me .... Let me explain.... She doesnt like sad movies but... This movie kept me on breaking edge of all emotions so i forgot to mention that  It is sad and then happy best tear jerker ever
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: This story/movie addresses major societal issues like: a broken marriage, financial struggles, a rewarding and fulfilling career, loss of a loved one and restoration. Many people in today's society are able to relate to this kind of film because of the hardships that people are facing on a daily basis.I would recommend this movie/novel to anyone who knows of someone who is going through a hard time. Sure faith and religion are also introduced into this film, but this comes across in my opinion as a low influential religious impact. Many kids can also relate to Josh and Rachael's characters based on the adoption rate and the foster home interactions and surroundings. Before watching this film I went to the production companies website to make sure that it was family friendly and to see what the ratings were. Although this moving is under-rated by people I think that they hit it big when they signed on with the filming company.
summary: Destiny Image Films hit it big!!
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: Good family movie, not for the very young though as our 3 year old couldn't stay interested. The movie was formulaic and slow with so-so acting. The story was nice and certainly fit for the whole family.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: The Lamp was a great movie that I would think would be good for the family. It teaches you so much and makes you think what has happened and what ended up happening. Heartfelt. My daughter and I really enjoyed it and we plan to watch it again. Watch it you may get something out of it if you have a opened mind.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: It was a christmas gift for my grandaughter.  She likedit a lot and it made for an easy gift.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: This movie is heart warming and deep in relationship building.  Good characters and with a tweet to the surprise ending.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: I previewed this movie for my 5 and 7 year olds and it was too serious for my taste. The movie starts out with a couple whose child passed away 2 years earlier and the father's difficulty in getting through this tragic event. I stopped watching when the magic lamp came into the story (which was about 30 minutes into the movie). But having a G rating, I thought it would be geared more toward younger children. The movie itself isn't bad, but just not what I was looking for for my children.
Title: The Lamp

reviewText: "The Lamp" is a sleeper. A very simple movie. No great special effects, just life.Grief is expressed through a father who felt responsible for losing his only son. He then lost all love for himself and those around him. He felt it impossible to overcome. He was truly lost!The meaningful part of this well done, well casted movie, was that he really never needed the "Lamp," just an opportunity to see the beauty of life through children.Again, it is a simple movie, but one with a great message. God knows we need more movies like this in these most difficult, material times. Help is coming... Just Believe!Highly recommended.TaosGuy
Title: The Lamp
